Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Jelleine-II (RJ II; Jelleine-2, Leu-rich; UCLL1c; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity:Active against G+ bacteria S. aureus ATCC 6535 (MIC 15 ug/ml), S. saprophyticus (MIC 10 ug/ml), B. subtilis CCT 2471 (MIC 30 ug/ml), and G- bacteria E. coli CCT 1371 (MIC 15 ug/ml), E. cloacae ACCT 23355 (MIC 15 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae ACCT 13883 (MIC 15 ug/ml), P. aeruginsa ACCT 27853 (MIC 15 ug/ml), and yeast C. albicans (MIC 2.5 ug/ml).  Jelleines are produced constitutively by the workers and secreted into Royal Jelly. Compared to jellein-I, jellein-II only contains one additional residue T at the N-terminus. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Fontana R, Mendes MA, de Souza BM, Konno K, CÃ©sar LM, Malaspina O, Palma MS2004
Literature Information.Title: Jelleines: a family of antimicrobial peptides from the Royal Jelly of honeybees (Apis mellifera).
